result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua William Hurley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua William Hurley in court with attorney Richard Russell Mccue.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to each count; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 90 days RCJail each count Concurrent, but Consecutive to any other sentence: with Huber, May work in all Counties in State of Wisconsin and Illinois.   Stayed-Call Diversion 373-3880 M-F by 03-02-2016 to Report by 04-28-2016.  If not, Commitment to issue without huber  privileges and new criminal charges. $886 costs ex to 04-28-2016, Bond to apply, may apply for Payment plan. If Diversion allows, 16 hours/day..Judge will hear that issue later. 2 days credit
